subject: Fashion
title: Marine Serre's Upcycling Vision
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Marine Serre's Upcycling Vision.

hook.text: Marine Serre built a collection from old scarves, bedsheets, and deadstock. Nothing was new.

buildup.text: Her signature crescent-moon print appears on bodysuits made from reclaimed materials.

discovery.text: Serre treats upcycling not as a gimmick but as the foundation of her entire design philosophy.

twist.text: She won the LVMH Prize at 26. Luxury's biggest company backed a designer who avoids new fabric.

climax.text: Serre is building the template for what fashion might have to become: beautiful and responsible.

punchline.text: She makes tomorrow's fashion from yesterday's trash.

quiz.question: What is the foundation of Marine Serre's design philosophy?
options: Using only the most expensive new fabrics available
Upcycling reclaimed materials as the core of every collection
Designing exclusively digital clothing for virtual reality
